variant.question: Which of the following statements in reference to the display of aircraft on a primary ATC radar is correct?

options.text: Both the range and bearing to the aircraft can be estimated simultaneously.
Both the range and bearing to the aircraft can be estimated but NOT simultaneously.
Only the bearing to the aircraft can be estimated.
Only the range to the aircraft can be estimated.

variant.question: Which one of the following is an advantage of a secondary radar system when compared to a primary radar system?

options.text: The required power of transmission from the ground equipment is reduced.
The relatively small ground antenna transmits no side lobes, thus eliminating the danger of false replies from the airborne transponder.
Possibility of obtaining speed information for aircraft within range.
Is not limited to line of sight.

variant.question: A secondary radar can provide up to 4 096 different codes. These 4 096 codes can be used in:

options.text: all modes.
mode S only.
mode A only.
mode C only.

variant.question: Why can Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR) systems provide ATC with more information than Primary Surveillance Radar (PSR) systems?

options.text: ATC SSR systems can interrogate an aircraft transponder and elicit replies.
ATC SSR systems can reply to an aircraft interrogation and offer to provide the requested information.
As ATC SSR systems continuously interrogate aircraft within range, tracking is uninterrupted.
ATC SSR systems have Moving Target Indicator (MTI) capability, which eliminates ground clutter and allows more aircraft to be tracked.

variant.question:
Which of the following types of radar equipment operate by means of the pulse technique?
1. Aerodrome Surface Movement Radar2. Airborne Weather Radar3. Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR)4. Aerodrome Surveillance -approach- Radar

options.text: 2, 3 and 4 only
2 and 4 only
1, 2 and 4 only

variant.question: Which one of the following Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR) codes should be used by aircraft entering airspace from an area where SSR operation has not been required?
Which of the following statements describes an advantage of SSR over primary radar?

options.text: SSR allows the identification of a primary radar target by its code and call sign.
SSR allows the identification of aircraft without a working mode A/C/S transponder.
SSR is resistant to garbling and fruiting.
SSR relies only on the reception of a reflected pulse of a radar target.

variant.question: A Secondary Surveillance Radar (SSR) sends out an interrogation signal, then receives a...

options.text: reply signal on a different frequency.
reflected signal with Doppler frequency change.
reply signal on the same frequency.
reflected signal on the same frequency.
